newsitem.title: USA: USDA opposes cut in EEP, cap on new CRP entries.
newsitem.headline: USDA opposes cut in EEP, cap on new CRP entries.

text.p: A U.S. House committee acted prematurely in voting to limit new enrollments in the Conservation Reserve Program and to limit the Export Enhancement Program to $10 million this fiscal year, an Agriculture Department spokesman said Thursday.
"We believe in full funding for EEP," said spokesman Tom Amontree.
Amontree reiterated USDA opposition to capping new CRP enrollments at 14 million acres this year.
EEP, the major U.S. export subsidy program, initially was given $100 million for this fiscal year.
The committee also voted to reduce funding for USDA export credit guarantees to $3.5 billion.
The reductions were part of an emergency spending bill to aid victims of floods and other disasters. It may be debated by the full House as early as next week.
